fixed_content: UNHCR adheres to a comprehensive annual programme cycle within a multi-year strategy, where monitoring and evaluation are intrinsic parts of the Results-Based Programme Management cycle. Throughout the year, progress of activities is monitored based on the M&E plan, which includes field visits, missions, and regular consultations with community members, partners, service providers, and other stakeholders.  **8.2. Audit**: UNHCR is audited in accordance with the UN Financial Regulations and the UNHCR Financial Rules. All financial transactions and related activities covered by these regulations and rules are subject to audit by internal auditors and the United Nations Board of Auditors. UNHCR's annual financial statements are published on the Board of Auditors' website here.  **8.3. Reporting**: UNHCR will submit a final narrative report, including a financial component, three months after the completion of the project.
